diagnosed.name: CKD staging
diagnosed.description:
Description: Patients with correct coding of CKD staging (Stage 3 or above) based on their latest eGFR and ACR readings.
Eligible patients: Patients with a CKD diagnostic code (stage 3 or above) without an exclusion code.
Correct patients: Patients with a CKD staging code matching their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings.
diagnosed.tagline: of your patients with a CKD code have the correct stage recorded based on their eGFR and ACR readings.
diagnosed.positiveMessage: There's room for improvement - but don't be disheartened! Look through the recommended improvement actions on this page and for each patient.

wrongStage.name: Wrong stage
wrongStage.description: Patients who have the wrong CKD stage in their records according to their latest eGFR and ACR readings.

rightStageWrongSubstage.name: Right stage, wrong substage
rightStageWrongSubstage.description: Patients who have the right CKD stage but the wrong CKD substage in their records according to their latest eGFR and ACR readings.

overdiagnosed.name: Overdiagnosed
overdiagnosed.description: Patients with a CKD code whose latest eGFR readings do not meet the criteria for CKD diagnosis stage 3 or above.

acrTest.name: ACR missing
acrTest.description: Patients with a CKD code who do not have an ACR test result in their record to enable accurate CKD staging.

suggestExclude.name: Suggest exclude
suggestExclude.description: Patients with a CKD code who may benefit from being excluded from CKD quality indicators.

monitoring.name: Correct CKD monitoring
monitoring.description:
Description: Patients with CKD (Stage 3 and above) who have received the correct frequency of eGFR monitoring based on their latest eGFR and ACR readings.
Eligible patients: Patients with a CKD diagnostic code (stage 3 or above) who do not have an exclusion code.
Correct patients: Patients who have the correct frequency of monitoring based on their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings.
monitoring.tagline: of your patients with a CKD code have been correctly monitored based on their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings.
monitoring.positiveMessage: Well done! For tips on how to improve further, look through the recommended improvement actions on this page and for each patient.

underContact.name: Under monitored - contact with practice
underContact.description: Patients with a CKD code who have not been monitored correctly based on their latest eGFR and ACR readings but who have had contact with your practice in the last year.

underNoContact.name: Under monitored - NO contact with practice
underNoContact.description: Patients with a CKD code who have not been monitored correctly based on their latest eGFR and ACR readings and who have had no contact with your practice in the last year.

overMonitored.name: Over monitored
overMonitored.description: Patients with a CKD code who have had more than 4 eGFR readings in the last year.

acrTest.name: ACR missing
acrTest.description: Patients with a CKD code who do not have an ACR test result in their record to enable accurate CKD monitoring.

overdiagnosed.name: Overdiagnosed
overdiagnosed.description: Patients with a CKD code whose latest eGFR readings do not meet the criteria for CKD diagnosis stage 3 or above.

suggestExclude.name: Suggest exclude
suggestExclude.description: Patients with a CKD code who may benefit from being excluded from CKD quality indicators.

undiagnosed.name: CKD diagnosis
undiagnosed.description:
Description: Patients with a diagnosis of CKD (Stage 3 or above) based on their eGFR and ACR readings.
Eligible patients: Patients with recent eGFR readings persistently less than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 who do not have an exclusion code.
Correct patients: Patients who have a diagnostic code of CKD stage 3 or above.
undiagnosed.tagline: of your patients with CKD according to their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings have a CKD code in their records.
undiagnosed.positiveMessage: Well done! For tips on how to improve further, look through the recommended improvement actions on this page and for each patient.

addCode.name: Add a diagnostic code
addCode.description: Patients who have CKD according to their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings but have no CKD code in their record.

acrTest.name: ACR missing
acrTest.description: Patients with a CKD code who do not have an ACR test result in their record to enable accurate CKD diagnosis.

suggestExclude.name: Suggest exclude
suggestExclude.description: Patients with a CKD code who may benefit from being excluded from CKD quality indicators.
